Sentencas: The properties and the applicability of iron- and cobalt-containing perovskites were evaluated as cathodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) in comparison to state-of-the-art manganite-based perovskites.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: The materials examined were Laj(1-x-y)SrCo(0.2)Fe(0.8)O(3-delta) (x = 0.2 and 0.4; y = 0-0.05), La0.8Sr0.2FeO3-delta, La0.7Ba0.3Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta and Ce0.05Sr0.95Co0.2FeO0.8O3-delta.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: The main emphasis was placed on the electrochemical properties of the materials, which were investigated on planar anode-supported SOFCs with 8 mol% yttria-stabilised zirconia (8YSZ) electrolytes.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: An interlayer of the composition Ce0.8Gd0.2O2-delta was placed between the electrolyte and the cathode to prevent undesired chemical reactions between the materials.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: The sintering temperatures of the cathodes were adapted for each of the materials to obtain similar micro structures.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: In comparison to the SOFCs with state-of-the-art manganite-based cathodes, SOFCs with La1-x-ySrCo0.2Fe0.8O3-delta cathodes achieved much higher current densities.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: Small A-site deficiency and high strontium content had a particularly positive effect on cell performance.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: The measured current densities of cells with these cathodes were as high as 1.76 A/cm(2) at 800 degrees C and 0.7 V, which is about twice the current density of cells with LSM/YSZ cathodes.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition

Sentencas: SOFCs with La0.58Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta cathodes have been operated for more than 5000 h in endurance tests with a degradation of 1.0-1.5% per 1000 h. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V.
Titulo: Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition
Ferrite-based perovskites as cathode materials for anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells Part I.: Variation of composition
